item.title: After Dark at the Eiffel Tower: A Local's Guide to Paris Magic
item.itunes:title: After Dark at the Eiffel Tower: A Local's Guide to Paris Magic
item.description:
Discover the enchanting secrets of Paris's most iconic landmark in this illuminating episode of Croissants and Castles, where we unveil the magic that unfolds at the Eiffel Tower after sunset. While daytime crowds flock to this architectural marvel, we reveal why savvy travelers and locals alike cherish the Tower's evening transformation. From significantly reduced wait times after 8 PM to the newly unveiled green terrace on the first floor, this episode offers insider knowledge that transforms a typical tourist experience into an unforgettable Parisian adventure. Learn why timing your visit with the late-setting summer sun creates perfect golden hour photo opportunities, and discover the hidden gem of dining at Madame Brasserie, where exquisite French cuisine meets panoramic city views. We explore how the Tower's evening atmosphere shifts from tourist hotspot to sophisticated local hangout, much like the transformation seen in other global landmarks. With practical tips about last elevator times and strategic timing for the best experience, this episode provides essential insights for experiencing the City of Light's crown jewel as it was meant to be seen - bathed in the golden glow of evening and sparkling under the stars.

item.title: Paris: Manhattan with Training Wheels
item.itunes:title: Paris: Manhattan with Training Wheels
item.description:
In this illuminating episode of Croissants and Castles, discover a fresh perspective on Paris that transforms the City of Light into a remarkably accessible destination for American families. Drawing fascinating parallels between Paris and New York City, the episode reveals how Paris's compact size and well-organized arrondissements make it surprisingly navigable for first-time visitors. From the practical benefits of the city's new smoking bans in public spaces to insider tips on avoiding tourist crowds, listeners gain valuable insights into experiencing Paris like a local. The discussion covers recent changes following the Olympics, including the implementation of a new tourist tax and its positive impacts on visitor experiences. Learn why visiting major attractions during the early evening hours (5-7 PM) can enhance your family's experience, and how understanding the Parisian daily rhythm can lead to more authentic encounters. Special attention is given to the city's evolving art scene, including the Fondation Cartier's relocation near the Louvre, while practical advice about the Metro system and neighborhood navigation helps families plan their Parisian adventure with confidence.
Further Reading: • "Paris with Kids: A Family-Friendly Guide to the City of Light" - Book (https://amazon.com/books/paris-with-kids-family-friendly-guide) • "Rick Steves Paris" - Book (https://amazon.com/books/rick-steves-paris-2025) • "Paris's New Tourism Initiatives Transform Visitor Experience" (https://www.france24.com/en/paris-tourism-2025) • "Understanding Paris Arrondissements: A Visitor's Guide" (https://www.parisinfo.com/arrondissements-guide) • "The Evolution of Paris's Art Scene" (https://www.theartnewspaper.com/paris-art-scene-2025)
